skill.name: baseline-ui
skill.description: Enforces an opinionated UI baseline to prevent AI-generated interface slop.
skill.summary: Enforces an opinionated UI baseline to prevent AI-generated interface slop.
skill.author: ibelick

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. SKILL.md is a text-based UI guideline document containing only markdown documentation with inline code references. No executable code, command execution, network requests, or cryptographic operations exist. The skill is purely informational guidance.

content.value_statement: AI-generated interfaces often suffer from poor accessibility, animation performance issues, and inconsistent design patterns. This skill provides opinionated guidelines to ensure all UI work meets professional quality standards.
actual_capabilities: Reviews UI code against accessibility standards
Ensures typography and layout best practices
limitations: Does not execute code or install dependencies
Does not provide visual previews or testing

use_cases.title: Code review for UI changes
use_cases.description: Submit UI components or files to ensure they meet baseline quality standards before committing.

use_cases.title: Learning accessibility patterns
use_cases.description: Understand how to properly use accessible component primitives and aria attributes in React applications.

use_cases.title: Quality gate for AI assistants
use_cases.description: Use as a quality checklist when AI assistants generate UI code to catch common mistakes before deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Quick file review
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui <filename>

Review this file against all the baseline UI constraints and report any violations.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick check of a single component file

prompt_templates.title: Detailed violation analysis
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui <filename>

For each violation found, provide:
1. The exact line or snippet that violates the rule
2. Why this matters for accessibility or performance
3. A concrete code-level fix suggestion

prompt_templates.title: Animation audit
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui <filename>

Focus specifically on the animation guidelines. Check for:
- Properties that should not be animated (layout, paint)
- Animation duration limits
- reduced-motion respect
- Looping animation handling

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility check
prompt_templates.prompt:
/baseline-ui <filename>

Focus specifically on accessibility requirements:
- aria-labels on icon buttons
- Dialog usage for destructive actions
- Error placement and messaging
- Component primitive usage

output: 1. Line 23: Missing aria-label on icon-only button
Why: Screen readers cannot announce the button's purpose
Fix: Add aria-label="Close dialog" to the button element
Why: Animating layout properties causes reflow and performance issues
No violations found. Component meets baseline UI standards.
- Uses cn utility for class merging

best_practices: Use component primitives from established libraries like Radix, React Aria, or Base UI instead of building accessible behavior from scratch.
Always respect user motion preferences with prefers-reduced-motion media queries to avoid causing discomfort.
Keep animations focused on compositor-only properties (transform, opacity) for smooth 60fps performance.
anti_patterns: Manually rebuilding keyboard or focus behavior instead of using established component primitives.
Animating layout properties like width, height, or margin which trigger expensive reflows.
Using arbitrary z-index values instead of a fixed scale, leading to stacking context conflicts.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reviews and reports violations. You must apply fixes manually or with your AI assistant's help.

faq.question: What stacks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill is designed for React projects using Tailwind CSS, clsx, tailwind-merge, and motion/react for animations.

faq.question: Can I skip these guidelines for simple components?
faq.answer: The skill enforces consistent standards regardless of component complexity. Consider starting simple and adding complexity only when needed.

faq.question: How do I request custom easing curves?
faq.answer: Explicitly mention you want custom easing in your prompt. The skill defaults to standard ease-out for entrances.

faq.question: What if my project uses a different component library?
faq.answer: The skill references Base UI, Radix, and React Aria as examples. Apply equivalent patterns from your chosen library.

faq.question: Does this work with CSS Modules or other styling approaches?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Tailwind CSS conventions. Non-Tailwind projects can still benefit from animation, accessibility, and layout principles.
